conversations.content: You're off on a survey of Alberia's beaches, you say?
Indeed. As an island nation, Hinomoto is susceptible to floods. I wish to observe how others have responded to this issue.
Seeing their solutions and applying those lessons in new policy will be a true test of my abilities. It also requires that I travel.
As such, I would ask you to watch over these lands in my absence. Will you do me this kindness?
I would keep your domain safe at any cost.
Thank you, and pardon the imposition.
It's no trouble at all, my lord. Besides, a trip to the shoreline with no cumbersome entourage sounds like a fine opportunity.
You're always so buried in work. I hope you'll take this chance to unwind a little.
At the very least, I will endeavor to bring you home an entertaining story or three.
Even I'm not so intractable as to refrain from ALL of summer's myriad delights. Heh... Here's to a fruitful journey.
Some time later...  South Grastaea Fellista
That melancholy mien of his... It's enough to make me swoon!
Right? I'd love to get to know him better, but my knees quake at the thought of so much as saying a friendly ＂hello.＂
Goodness. That was positively exhausting!
Sure was.
It's been three days, and the few meager scraps of information we've gleaned have been sandwiched between fête after fête.
The local lord's going all-out. You heard his whole spiel about giving you a suitable reception as an honored guest and all that.
And I appreciate his kindness. But I came to observe the systems in place here for myself, and to learn what I can from them.
Not to peer at the sea through a telescope while swilling cocktails with socialites. And yet...
*glance*
The butler they have watching us seems dead-set on corralling us within the manor premises.
My aspirations for this trip grow less attainable by the second...
We could always write off the rest of the trip and just party till we leave.
No. My duties as wyrmclan leader demand more of me than that. I must survey the site for myself, whatever it takes. And so—
I propose a jailbreak! Er, partybreak?
A ＂partybreak...＂ Ha ha! So droll. If that isn't you in a nutshell, Ieyasu.
Well? Got an escape plan in mind yet?
I'm still thinking... Or, more to the point, I'm not acquainted enough with the lay of the land to formulate a proper strategy.
Which leaves only a full-frontal assault, I fear. Will you lend me your strength, Marishiten?
Does a boar defecate in the woods? I'll draw the butler's attention for a bit. Slip out while his back is turned.
As ever, I am in your debt. Now... Let us begin!
Phew... I managed to make it this far while our little ＂sentry＂ was distracted by the sudden explosion. Thank you.
No prob. I don't mind a good party, but I was getting bored to tears back th—
Wait. We've been followed!
So THERE you are, Lord Ieyasu! Come, let us return to the party, sir.
Guh! He actually chased us down?! This guy is nuts!
Rgh... If we're caught here, we may not soon get another chance. But how to—?
Hey! You two! What's wrong? You on the run? Is it 'cause one of you's a dragon?
Huh? Er...yes. You see, I've a surveying mission I must complete, but it requires me to escape from that butler.
I don't really follow, but meh. Whatever.
You seem pretty desperate. I'll show you a way out if you buy me a shaved ice.
You have yourself a deal!
Great! Follow me. And you better hold up your end of the bargain!
*huff* *huff* We definitely left him in the dust this time... Right?
Relax. I took you through a buncha alleyways only a local would know. That guy's miles away by now.
That's a relief. Now I can finally get some real work done. Though, I must say...
We got shaved ice! We got noodles! You want both? We even got shoodles! ...Okay, I made that last one up, but whatever you need, we got it here!
Ooh, I hear there's a pack of seals over there. Let's see if we can sneak a peek!
Beach volleyball's not some GAME! I want to see blood, sweat, and tears, people!
This place is so lively! I suppose I should expect nothing less of Fellista Beach, it being one of Alberia's top resort spots.
Huh... Everybody's as carefree as can be. Must not be much crime here.
Making it an ideal spot for my survey.
But where to begin? I'll confess I'm something of a stranger to resorts.
Sheltered much? Between that and your fancy vocab, I'm guessing you're some kinda fancy diplomat?
Something like that, yes. My mission is to observe the workings of Fellista Beach and learn what I can from them this summer.
And that begins with creating a full picture of what one does here at the shore.
Huh. Well, if you need a tour guide, I can be your guy.
You... You don't mind?
Meh, why not? Summer break gets boring after a while. Besides, I feel like you'd end up face-first in a trash can or something if I let you wander around all slack-jawed.
It'll cost you extra, though. Namely, fresh juice and a crepe with the works on top.
Of course. I shall gladly compensate you for your time and expertise. Having a local to guide me would be invaluable.
It's a done deal. Guess we'll be seeing a lot of each other this summer, uh... Sorry, didn't catch your name. I'm Setta.
Ah! How rude of me. I am Ieyasu, and this is my pactbound dragon, Marishiten.
Whoa, you've got a pact with a dragon?! You are CRACKED, my guy.
Ha ha. I am unsure how that makes me... fractured, was it? But I look forward to our time together, young Setta!
Phew. I think that covers everything around this part of the beach.
You've been a most thorough guide. Thank you, Setta.
Aw, no problem. You've treated me to an entire smörgåsbord of snacks by this point. And eaten twice that yourself, too.
He's got a beast of a sweet tooth, this one. He's been on cloud nine getting to try new treats down here.
And all of them have been scrumptious! Though the greatest treat of all has been relishing in this peaceful atmosphere.
There wasn't so much as a hint of strife the whole time we were eating. Is the beach entirely free of fiends?
Nah, there's some here and there. But the town watch and lifeguards keep everything nice 'n orderly.
I've never heard of a ＂lifeguard.＂
They keep watch to make sure no one drowns. They also handle pesky fiends.
Ah, so that's what you call your marine watchmen! Having them train for combat and work in tandem with the land watch is brilliantly efficient.
Right? Because of them, fiends only make it all the way to the beach once every few years, if that. That way, you can let loose without having to watch your back!
Sure, if never getting to blow off steam on fiends is your idea of ＂fun.＂ Me, I like the occasional—
Ah... AAAAAAAH!
The hell was that?!
SkreeeeeEEEEE!
Nrgh! This one's tough! I can't hold it back!
A large fiend has broken through the defensive line! It's headed this way. Setta, get to safety!
But... How? Fiends almost never show up at the—
SKREEEEEEEEE!
Eeagh! A-ahhh... AAAAAH!
You'll taste the Wyrmgrace Blade before you touch the boy!
Rgh, the flames are too powerful... My sword can't reach its core. Marishiten!
On it! We'll see how long those flames last when I chuck it into the sea! NRAAAH!
Skree?!
There. Now, let's hope that cools it off a—
Sksksksksk...
Ah... It got up. It's leaving!
Tch. Guess I held back a little too much. I was trying to finish the job.
Perhaps, but you did buy us time. Setta, are you all right?
HolycrapholycrapholyCRAP!
Er... Setta?
You're AWESOME, Ieyasu! What was that sword move just now?! You were like... KAPWIIING! I couldn't even SEE it!
To be honest, I thought you were kinda clueless, but I was WAY wrong. You're a total freakin' sword master!
Ha...ha ha. You are most gracious.
But we must remain vigilant. That fiend may well return to the beach before long.
We won't stop it for good unless we can neutralize its defensive flames somehow. The question is how.
True. Hmmm, fire... How to put out a fire...
...Ah! I think I've got an idea! Ieyasu, mind lending me a hand?
With your skills, this'll go off without a hitch.
Skreee!
Okay. The fiend's back! We'll do it just like we planned, Ieyasu. Push it back towards that island!
Understood. My Wyrmgrace Blade is ready!
Skree?! SKREEEEEEEEE!
Good, it took the bait. Now, PULL! And stay behind me if you don't wanna get hurt, kid.
Got it. More to the right, Ieyasu! Right!
Understood! HAAAAH!
Skreeeeeee!
NOW! Fling it close to the island!
Leave it to me! Take this: Sakura Flurry!
S-skree?! Skrik-krik...SKREEE!
Yesss! You did it!
...Huh. That thing went under in a hurry. No sign of it coming back up, either.
Because the rip tide got that sucker. It's so intense around that island that the whole area is off limits. They say even the best swimmers get pulled under.
A big, strong shell and a bunch of fire ain't jack against a current that strong.
Interesting. And you figured Ieyasu'd be strong enough to chase it there. Not bad, kid!
Heh. It's no biggie. Just goes to show that even fiends can't beat the ocean. At least now we don't have to worry about—
SKREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!
Wha?
N-no WAY! It's still... It's still alive! Waaaaaugh!
SAKURA FLURRY!
Grrraaaaargh!
That was too close for my comfort. Can you stand, Setta?
Y-you seriously beat that thing?! You really ARE amazing!
The fierce currents had stripped it of the flame that protected it. At that point, even my humble blade was enough to lay it low.
It is all thanks to your strategy, Setta. This is not my victory, but a triumph of local wisdom.
Oh. I...hadn't thought of it that way.
In the end, native expertise wins out. This has served as a good reminder.
When I return home, I shall make a point of enlisting residents of the shoreline to direct the efforts to protect those areas.
Sounds like a plan to me. They'll know shortcuts and hazards better than anyone.
That is precisely my hope. Setta, thank you for your contributions to my surveying efforts here.
You have been a most excellent guide. I hope you'll consider continuing to aid me from tomorrow on as well.
You bet! Leave it to me, Ieyasu. I'll show you around all SORTS of places!
Lord Ieyaaasu! Where have you run off to?
...Is he gone?
Yup. And luckily for us, we're headed in the exact opposite direction today. I think we're safe to mosey.
Splendid. I would've hated to postpone my observation of the lifeguards.
Gotta hand it to that butler—he's a lot wilier than he looks. Persistent, too. The guy is EVERYWHERE.
Truly. And he's only redoubled his efforts to locate us with each passing day. I do feel a bit guilty leading him around...
But not guilty enough to allow an entire summer to be wasted on frivolous revelry.
Sounds like you guys have it rough. I guess survey tours aren't quite as fun as they sound, even if you ARE checking out a seaside paradise.
Anyway, that's enough commiserating. We're nearly there.
Aaand we made it. Hey, bro! These are the people I told you about!
Hey, Setta and company! We've been waiting for you. Welcome!
You wanted to ask about Fellista Beach's lifeguards, yeah?
Correct. Might I add that I am humbled you would take time away from your duties to indulge my request? This is invaluable.
Don't sweat it. It's my pleasure. Now, to get right into it, our number one job is accident prevention.
Which means our priority is keeping a constant watch on the shore.
That much is identical to our own system. Unfortunately, we still see incidents occur from time to time.
Right. Which brings me to the next most important part of our work: getting help to those who need it as swiftly as possible.
And to do that, we use the seacutter.
Sea...cutter? The heck is that?
Put simply, it's a vehicle that runs on the water. Our friends in Chanzelia unearthed one and restored it to working order.
Seeing as Chanzelia is landlocked, they were kind enough to loan it to us in exchange for data from its use here.
I see. It does seem rather fascinating. The chassis design in particular sparks a certain natural curiosity.
Eyyy, this guy gets it! Ooh, I know. Wanna take it for a spin?
Oh! Er... May I?
Of course! Right this way.
So this is the seacutter... Sitting astride it conjures to mind my equestrian escapades.
Funny you should mention that—the Chanzelian engineers said they based their redesign on horseback riding. Now, let's take her out. Ready?
Whenever you are, sir. ...Goodness! This—
It's so FAST! Agile, too! If it responds so readily to my commands... Hyah!
It feels like an extension of my body. Heh, I'm reminded of the night I raced my horse up the mountain pass behind the manor!
Someone sure is acting like a kid on Dragonyule. You're adorable, Ieyasu.
I confess, it's rather thrilling! This seacutter might even outpace a dragon.
...What'd you just say?
You think that thing's faster than ME? If that's a joke, I'm not laughing.
Erm! It was in no way my intention to cast any doubts or aspersions on your abilit—
Can it! Whatever your ＂intention,＂ it's something one race will settle. Now take your weird un-horse and let's do this!
What?!
Talky time's over, pal. First one to that little island and back wins. Ready? GO!
Marishiten! Agh... I suppose I'll only make this worse if I ignore her. Apologies, sir. I'll be borrowing this awhile longer!
Huh? Oh—whoa. There he goes. Well, uh... YOU GOT THIS, IEYASU!
There, see? I'm way faster than that rickety antique.
*huff* *huff* Is that any surprise? I'm on a vehicle I only just discovered, whereas you've been flying since birth.
But without question, this victory is yours. Now, I should like to put this whole conversation behind us and move on.
Fine by me. No point dragging it out when I'd just beat you every time. Maybe this'll teach you to watch what you say.
Yes, yes. You've made it abundantly clear that you're—
That's not true!
Er... Setta?
I was watching the whole time. Ieyasu was holding back. I could tell!
He's REALLY strong. If he was trying his hardest, he would never lose! Right, Ieyasu?!
That's not true! Ieyasu's WAY stronger than you!
If he didn't trip at the very start, he'd have beaten you, EASY! He only held back 'cause you have seniority... *sniff*
WAAAAAH! Ieyasu would never lose for real!
(Ha ha, that brought me back. The time I spent studying at the dojo with Botan feels so nostalgic now.)
(I'd lost a sparring match, and Botan came to my defense just like Setta. Then she made me promise to win the next bout.)
You truly think I'm capable, Setta?
Doy! You've GOT this, Ieyasu. Just give it one more go!
A tempting thought. Back then, my place in the hierarchy prevented me from asking for a rematch, but now...
Huh? Back when?
Ha ha, I'm just talking to myself. I think I would like to reclaim my honor after all.
I can't very well let your faith in me go misplaced. Now, Marishiten, I challenge you to a rematch!
Oh ho! Bold of you to pick a fight with this particular dragon. But then again, it's not altogether surprising you would.
Either way, you're on. And you know I'm not gonna be holding back, so you better come at me with everything you've got.
I wouldn't dream of doing otherwise. Watch closely, Setta. Here I go!
Woo! You show her, Ieyasu!
HaaaAAAH!
There's that fire I knew you had. Reminds me of when we first swore a pact.
The day I said that world domination was incidental, and asked your aid in protecting the peace?
I thought you were out of your gourd. Still do, really. But I knew you were the kinda guy who fought hardest for others.
...Which explains why you're faster this time around. I'm giving it all I've got, and you still passed me!
The occasional upset is what keeps an uneven match fun. Plus, I'm under explicit orders from Sazanka to cut loose a bit.
So I'm very sorry, but I'll be winning this round. I hope you won't take it personally! HAAAAH!
I can do this! As long as I maintain this pace until the end, victory is—
LORD IEYASU!
WHAT?!
I've finally found you, Lord Ieyasu!
The BUTLER?! We're out on open water here! And I thought this guy was persistent BEFORE!
No butler worth his salt would fail to receive his masters' guests because of a little thing like the ocean being in his way!
Now, let us return forthwith, Lord Ieyasu. A most resplendent party awaits y—waugh?!
Sir! No... When he extended his hand to me, it caused his dinghy to capsize!
The... The party! *glub glubble blub*
Rgh... This is no time for vain competition. Forgive me, Setta.
My good man, I'll pull you up now! Give me your hand!
*cough* *sputter* *gasp* I'm... I'm saved...
Soft as ever, Ieyasu. But I hate a fight with no ending. I'm finishing this race out.
...So I'm afraid it was my loss yet again, Setta. My apologies.
I swore to rise to meet your expectations, but fell short. Forgive me this betrayal.
Aw, it's fine. Keep your chin up, Ieyasu.
Sure, it's a little frustrating. But you were cool out there when you rescued that guy.
Plus, your seacutter technique was on full display. Even from here, you looked like a pro!
He's right. It was an impressive display. Even among us lifeguards, there aren't many who could match it.
Besides, wasn't the whole point of your trip to see how they do rescue stuff here? I'd say you checked that box off just fine.
You're terribly kind, Setta. I thank you for your thoughtful words. Heh... You've once again reminded me of the past.
One of my dear friends growing up would often console me much as you just did. Truly, I'm blessed with excellent friends.
Yeah? You...do know flattery won't get you anything out of me, right? Not that I'm complaining; I'm just...kinda broke.
Ha ha. Kind AND modest! I shall have to work harder than ever to ensure I don't disappoint you again.
And, out of respect for the butler's tenacity, I will make a point of attending at least a few more social engagements as well.
That sounds less scary than having him chase you all the way out into the ocean again. I'm sure you'll survive.
I shall endeavor to! I plan to redouble my efforts, both in work and in enjoying this summer with you, Setta. On to the next!
Ahhh, time flies when you're having fun! Those old fishermen's stories are surprisingly wild, huh?
I found them most enlightening. It is wise to have those who know the sea best contribute that knowledge to its defense.
Ha ha! I hang out with them pretty often, so I'd heard a lot of it before, but I guess it's all new to you, huh?
Now that we've put a bow on today, what do you want to do tomorrow? Any ideas?
Anywhere you wanna go, just let me know! I'll make it happen.
A most generous offer, my friend. Sadly, I board a ship tomorrow afternoon to sail back home, so I cannot partake.
Huh. No kidding? You sail back tomorrow... Wait, TOMORROW?! Seriously?
I'm afraid so. Our time together has been so unrelentingly entertaining, I fear I never found the right moment to mention it.
I wish we had longer, and I do apologize for not telling you earlier. But I'm glad—
NO! I don't want to think about saying goodbye!
Er... Setta?
I don't want to watch some dumb boat come and take you away. I'm not... I won't come and see you off! I won't!
Ah—! Setta! Please, wait... Oh dear.
The Next Day Fellista Beach Harbor
...The little squirt really didn't show.
How regrettable that we should have to part like this.
The ship is ready to sail, Lord Ieyasu. You are welcome to board and await departure from the comfort of your cabin.
I suppose it's already that time. *sigh*
COME ON! Rescue formation, everyone! If we don't hurry, we'll lose Setta!
Did I hear that correctly...?
Pardon my interruption, but what's happened? Is Setta all right?
Oh, Ieyasu! Bad news, I'm afraid. Setta went into a dangerous cave by himself.
It's smack in the middle of an infamously rough patch of sea. Plus, it's nearly high tide. The water's only getting rougher.
What?! Please, allow me to assist in his rescue!
Lord Ieyasu, what are you saying?! I cannot allow an envoy from Hinomoto to engage in such a dangerous venture!
I implore you, leave this to the experts!
I will not, for I expect I bear some responsibility for Setta's actions.
Besides, he has been a true friend during my entire stay here. I will not stand idly by while he is in peril!
I beg you to understand my position. Please, permit me to make this right!
But, Lord Ieyasu...
*sigh* Very well. You have been a difficult guest to handle from the very start, but I cannot ignore so sincere a plea.
I suppose this must be the oft-touted honor of a Hinomotoan warrior on display. In which case... You there. Lifeguard!
Sir?
On behalf of my master, the lord of this land, offer whatever assistance you can to Lord Ieyasu in this matter.
Understood, sir. Ieyasu, you take the seacutter! We'll be right behind you on our rescue boats.
My thanks! I will not forget this kindness.
*cough* *gasp* You've gotta be kidding me... What's with these waves?!
How am I supposed to get back through this? And after I finally found what I was after, too.
I bet Ieyasu's mad I didn't show up to see him off.
Ugh, what am I doing? Am I really gonna... die here? Without getting to say I'm sorry?
SETTA!
...Huh?
Setta, are you all right?!
Wait, Ieyasu?! What are you doing HERE?! Weren't you headed back home today?
I couldn't very well leave you in danger. I've come to help!
Oh, geez... *sniff* Ieyasu!
I didn't mean for any of this. I've caused you nothing but trouble. I'm so, so sorry!
You've done nothing of the sort, Setta. I'm just relieved you're safe. But come, quickly. It will be high tide soon.
Right! Let's... Waugh?!
The cave is beginning to flood with seawater!
The waves have gotten too high. We'll drown if we stay here! But...
Blast. It's too dangerous to go out there with the sea this rough. Is there anything you can do, Marishiten?
Sorry. Even with my strength, carrying the two of you through those waves is a losing prospect. We'd just be swept away.
No... What are we supposed to do?!
At this rate, we'll all drown! We've gotta think of something!
We have to try to break through with the seacutter. We don't have the luxury of waiting around to form a better plan.
Awfully risky gambit. Did you not hear me when I said I can't support us all?
The waves are too rough. Try to force your way against the current, and it could wind up just sucking you under.
I'm not entirely without a plan here. Setta, you said you listen to the local fishermen's tales often, yes?
Can you recall them ever mentioning the placement of any standing nets?
Huh? Uhhh... Actually, yeah! They told me not to go near 'em 'cause it'd mess with their fishing. It was right around here, too!
Good. That tilts the odds in our favor a bit. Setta, you and I will do our best to head there.
Can you go and signal the rescue boats, Marishiten? I trust you can get out so long as it's only you.
Guess I don't have much choice, given the circumstances. Fine. But you owe me one.
I owe you far more than one, at this point. But come, Setta! We must make ready to depart. I'll be relying on your knowledge!
Right! I'll do my best!
Direction, Setta!
Uhhh, the spiky island's over there, so... Right! We need to go to the right! Augh, but there's a big wave coming from that—
We'll push through it by force. Hold on to me, and don't let go! HaaaAAAH!
HOLY—! Did... Did we just jump over that huge wave?!
I'll do whatever it takes to get you back to shore safely. Now, how's our course?
Good! We should be to the spot with the fishing nets soon. If we can hang on there until help comes—
Graaaargh!
GAH! Of all the times for a fiend to show!
GRAAAAARGH!
Aaaaaugh! I can't, I can't! Ieyasu, I'm scared!
Courage, Setta! We've no recourse but to face this foe head-on.
(You've helped me in so many ways this summer. Now it's time to repay you for that kindness.)
Things are about to get rougher than ever. I promise we'll be all right, so whatever you do, don't let go!
Ieyasu, I can't... *inhale* ...Okay. I trust you!
Thank you. Now, hang on! Wyrmgrace Blade, secret technique—
Luminous Sakura Flurry!
Skreeeaaargh!
We're through! Now, just a little further to the nets!
...I guess this is goodbye for real, Ieyasu.
I fear you're right. We only just barely made it back to land. I'm sorry that our farewell must be so rushed.
That's not your fault. I'm the one who messed up all your plans. But, um...
Would you accept these? It's fine if you don't want them!
Flowers?
Yeah. They only grow in the back of that cave, so they're pretty rare. I wanted to, uh...say I'm sorry for yesterday.
But going to get them only made MORE trouble for you, and they got all messed up from the salt water. B-but still, I just...
Of course I'll accept them! Thank you for the lovely gift, Setta.
They're as beautiful as the sentiment behind them. I shall dry and press them, so that I might cherish them forever.
They'll be a lovely souvenir of the summer I spent here, and a lasting symbol of our friendship.
Aw. Thanks, Ieyasu. And, um...come back anytime! I'll clear my calendar for you!
It's a promise. In the meantime, be well, Setta.
The ship is all ready to depart, Lord Ieyasu. This way, please.
...I take it you've found your experience here both pleasant and worthwhile?
It's been wonderful. And, er...my apologies for sneaking out of those parties.
Not at all. If anything, I was overzealous in my efforts to prevent anything untoward from happening to an honored guest.
You've certainly proven that you are a man both brave and capable enough to weather anything the sea can throw at you.
And a man true to his friends, besides. Please do pay us another visit soon. I promise you a more...relaxed reception.
I should like that very much, sir. Next time, I would like to come as a simple tourist, together with my entourage.
I just heard the reports, my lord. Seems all the new systems you put in place after your survey are integrating wonderfully.
The carpenters were abuzz working on your faster, sturdier ship designs, and the shore folk are coordinating well with the watch.
Thanks to their efforts, we've seen a sharp decline in incidents along the coast.
The shogun seemed quite pleased. If local conditions continue to improve, he means to apply these policies elsewhere as well.
Goodness! You've done a remarkable job as always, Lord Ieyasu. Your efforts speak for themselves, but...
The very fact that the results are so impressive makes me fear you did nothing but work while you were there.
I was just thinking the same. Pretty sure we told you it would've been okay— preferred, even—for you to enjoy yourself a bit more out there, my lord.
Worry not, Addis. I found ample time for both work AND play.
Why, I even tasted an array of delicious local treats and made a lifelong friend along the way.
How lovely!
Indeed it was. If you've the patience for it, I would be happy to regale you with a full account of everything that happened.
It is the tale of a summer well-spent in the company of a most charming young man.
